1359930824813129731.text:
"I hope you will come together and make absolutely clear how we, as a Congress and as nation, feel about what President Trump did by convicting him.

It is what our Constitution requires.  And it is what our country deserves."

1359929906382143491.text: "Impeachment, conviction and disqualification is not just about the past, it’s about the future.  It’s about making sure that no future official, no future president, does what President Trump did."

1359929555578929157.text:
"No one is here saying that President Trump cannot contest the election.

But what Trump did, as his former chief of staff explained, was different.  It was dishonorable. It was un-American. And it resulted in fatalities. "

1359927638903697410.text: "People in his own party, governors, former officials, current officials, and members of Congress have unambiguously and passionately said that what President Trump did was 'disgraceful' and 'shameful.'"

1359927484565839874.text:
"Now, Pres. Trump would have his base, & the world, believe that his conduct was totally appropriate. 

It is important to impeach that falsehood—to make clear to his supporters, & everyone watching, that what President Trump did was not acceptable. In fact, quite the opposite."

1359926227700772873.text: "If you or I make a mistake, and something very bad happens, we would show remorse. We would accept responsibility. But President Trump didn't do any of that. Why not? Because he intended for the events of January 6 to happen. How do we know? He told us."

1359925838007910407.text: "President Trump not only has failed to show remorse, or take accountability, he has made clear that he is just beginning."

1359925001177231370.text: "We have to hold Trump accountable. To send the message that it is never patriotic to incite a violent attack against our nation's Capitol. And that future Presidents will know that they can't follow in Donald Trump's footsteps and get away with it."

1359924288598532101.text: Now: Rep Lieu explains the threat of Trump’s lack of remorse: @HouseJudiciary #HoldTrumpAccountable https://t.co/yPf0YtB6oe

1359668473669054468.text: These solutions are absolutely right, which is why we are currently working on legislation to improve third-party IT vendor cybersecurity. The risks, as we have seen, are simply too great. https://t.co/J57lhBBYGa

1359588054764310533.text: "As you cast your vote, I hope each of you will think of the bravery of all these people who said no to Trump because they believed that this was not right, that this is not America."

1359587933465022469.text: "I began today by raising the question of how we got here—what you saw was a man so desperate to cling to power that he tried everything he could to keep it.  And when he ran out of non-violent measures, he turned to the violent mob attacked your senate chamber on January 6."

1359586703019769856.text: “We watched President Trump use any means necessary to pursue this aim, feverishly grasping at straws to retain his hold on the Presidency. But all his efforts prior to January 6 kept failing."

1359586565819953161.text: "President Trump’s actions, time and time again, made clear that he would do anything and pressure anyone if it meant overturning the election results."

1359585626539110402.text: "President Trump wasn’t just coming for one person, or two, or democrats like me...He was coming for all of us—just as the mob did as his direction."

1359584750059536393.text: “I’ll show you how we got here. President Donald J. Trump ran out of non-violent options to maintain power."
